comment: Smart Data models - OpaqueData schema derived from the open connectivity foundation repository https://github.com/openconnectivityfoundation/IoTDataModels adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/OpaqueData/schema.json
description: This Resource defines opaque data that can be transfered between endpoints where the data itself is not interpretable by the OCF endpoints.The stringdata is a string of ASCII characters.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: encoding
contents.comment: This Property describes the encoding of the payload, e.g. binary as base64, json, xml, utf-8.

contents.name: hash
contents.comment: The hash code of the blob. If present, it is used to check the decoded content of the object data point for integrity. The algorithm used for generating the hash value is SHA-2 [15]. The data point contains the hash as a hex encoded value.

contents.name: payload
contents.comment: This Property contains the opaque data.

contents.name: payloadtype
contents.comment: This Property describes the identification of the payload, e.g. what the payload is representing .

contents.name: size
contents.comment: The size in bytes of the decoded binary object.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: system
contents.comment: The eco system that is using the payload.

contents.name: if
contents.comment: The OCF Interface set supported by this Resource.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
